result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adria L. Stone

9:24 AM Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Adria L. Stone in court. Atty Spansail appears in court for the Deft.
Court calls case.
Copy of complaint.
Atty Spansail heard - has reviewed with Deft.
Deft understands.
Waives formal reading.
Requests prelim.
Deft waives time limits.
Court schedules with parties.
ADA heard on bond recommendation.
Court imposes $1000 signature bond w/ conditions; sign WOE, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid Rx.
9:32 AM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Arraignment scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

9:57 AM Defendant Adria L. Stone in court.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Spansail appears with the Deft.
Court calls case.
Atty Spansail heard - underlying case was to be dismissed.
ADA heard - Deft has an open warrant on the Branch 1 case.
Atty Spansail requests more time.
Court schedules.
Deft remanded into the custody of the Marinette County Sheriff's Department.
10:00 AM

OFF RECORD: 
Deputy Temple heard and states he does not find that the deft currently has an open warrant.
ADA heard - will have to check into it.
Court informs deft that she is free to leave.
